intro: Salacia pedunculata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in a variety of colors, including violet, pink, and white. Its leaves are typically velvety and heart-shaped, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Salacia pedunculata is widely cultivated as a houseplant due to its ability to thrive in indoor conditions with proper care.
